title: Theranos and its founder settle U.S. fraud charges - SEC
text: March 14, 2018 / 4:42 PM / Updated 24 minutes ago Theranos and its founder settle U.S. fraud charges - SEC Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Theranos Inc and its Chief Executive Elizabeth Holmes have agreed to settle fraud charges in a deal that strips her of control over the embattled blood-testing company, among other penalties, U.S. regulators said on Wednesday. Elizabeth Holmes, CEO of Theranos, attends a panel discussion during the Clinton Global Initiative's annual meeting in New York, September 29, 2015. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid/File Photo As part of the settlement, the Securities and Exchange Commission said Holmes must also return millions of shares to the privately-held company and cannot serve as an officer or director of a public company for 10 years. Reporting by Susan Heavey and Tim Ahmann, Editing by Franklin Paul
